parse.title: Armoured phantom
parse.text:
This article is about the monster appears in the Wilderness crypt. For the monster seen in Unwelcome Guests, see Armoured Phantom (Unwelcome Guests). For the monster summoned by Hermod, the Spirit of War, see Armoured phantom (Hermod).

Armoured phantom is a Slayer creature accessible following Unwelcome Guests. They require level 113 Slayer to kill, and are found within the Crypt north of Fort Forinthry.

Armoured phantoms fall under multiple Slayer categories; as themselves, Undead, and Zemouregal's undead. When killed as a standalone task, every kill counts as one kill. If killed on an Undead, or Zemouregal's undead task, each kill counts as three, while killing them on the Raptor's slayer challenge counts as four kills.

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Crypt (Wilderness)150None? edit? edit

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Armoured Phantoms will perform a special attack after every five auto attacks.

Armoured phantoms can also attack under players.

  • Healing Spirit: The phantom will enter a Rejuvenate animation, summoning a level 62 phantom spirit in a 5x5 area centred on it. This spirit has 500,000 life points and will heal the phantom for 7,875 life points (15% of their max life points) every few seconds. Inflicting a stun on the spirit will remove it. If the host phantom is killed, the spirit will despawn soon after.
  • Spirit Trauma: The phantom will slam the ground, looking like a Blood Ice Quake attack. If the player does not move away from the quake (3x3 area-of-effect centred on the target tile), they can take up to 7,000 magic damage, though the damage scales to the player's current health and can be blocked as normal magic damage. This will also inflict the spirit trauma debuff, reducing the effect of all healing sources for the player by 40% for 30 seconds.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • update 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Despite wielding large pikes, halberds or two-handed swords, armoured phantoms can only attack in a tile adjacent to their target.
  • Armoured phantoms' auto-attacks utilise halberd/two-handed sword animations, Slice and Punish despite not utilising adrenaline.
